titleStmt.title: Sighes at the contemporary deaths of those incomparable sisters, the Countesse of Cleaveland, and Mistrisse Cicily Killegrue, daughters of Sir Iohn Crofts Knight of Saxom Hall, in the Countie of Suffolke deceased, and his noble lady now living. Breathed forth by F.Q.

Sighes at the contemporary deaths of those incomparable sisters, the Countesse of Cleaveland, and Mistrisse Cicily Killegrue, daughters of Sir John Crofts Knight of Saxom Hall, in the Countie of Suffolke deceased, and his noble lady now living.
titleStmt.author: Quarles, Francis, 1592-1644.

titleStmt.title: Sighes at the contemporary deaths of those incomparable sisters, the Countesse of Cleaveland, and Mistrisse Cicily Killegrue, daughters of Sir Iohn Crofts Knight of Saxom Hall, in the Countie of Suffolke deceased, and his noble lady now living. Breathed forth by F.Q.

Sighes at the contemporary deaths of those incomparable sisters, the Countesse of Cleaveland, and Mistrisse Cicily Killegrue, daughters of Sir John Crofts Knight of Saxom Hall, in the Countie of Suffolke deceased, and his noble lady now living.
titleStmt.author: Quarles, Francis, 1592-1644.

publicationStmt.publisher: Printed by Tho. Cotes, for N. Alsop; and are to be sold at the Angell in Popes head Alley,

notesStmt.note: The first leaf and the last leaf are blank.
"An elegie. Vpon the truely lamented death of Sir Iohn Wolstenholme, Knight" has separate dated title page; register is continuous.
"An elegie" identified as STC 20539 on UMI microfilm reel 1359.
Reproductions of the original in the Henry E. Huntington Library and Art Gallery.
Appears at reel 1002 and at reel 1359 (same copy filmed twice).
